On Thu, 25 Jan 2001, Kevin Bourrillion wrote:

> Testing for thread-safety is a statistical proposition.
>  
> The best strategy I can think of is to have n different copies of your
> suite, each in random order, each running repeatedly in its own thread (n
> threads total), and let them all run for an extraordinarily long time.  If a
> failure is detected, you should write out a full thread dump so that you can
> see exactly what every thread was doing.  (Not sure if there's an easy way
> to do that--can the JVM send a SIGQUIT to itself??)

Sure.  That's what it does when you type Control-\ into a JVM.  You can
also use 'kill QUIT' to send it that signal from outside.

I was doing this yesterday while trying to diagnose a deadlocked 3rd 
party app.
